lines.speaker: Guard
lines.text: Another aspirant. Tell me, whose banner do you carry? Elysia's light? Sepulchure's shadow? Or Drakath's storm?

lines.speaker: PLAYER
lines.text: I serve {PLAYER_GOD}. I'm here to prove myself.

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.text: Then you've come to the right place. The Tower of Ascension—where mortals become legends. Your god has sponsored your entry. The fee is waived.

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.text: Though I wonder... how many times have I said these exact words to you?

lines.speaker: PLAYER
lines.text: What? We've never met.

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.text: No. Of course not. Proceed.

lines.speaker: Vile Serpent
lines.text: Back again, little champion? No? You don't remember? Good. They're getting better at the wipe.

lines.speaker: PLAYER
lines.text: What are you talking about? This is my first time here.

lines.speaker: Wraith
lines.text: That's what they all say. Every. Single. Time.

lines.speaker: Soul Eater
lines.text: You'll understand soon enough. Or you won't. Either way, we'll be seeing you again.

lines.speaker: PLAYER
lines.text: What... what are those voices?

lines.speaker: Warlord Grakthar
lines.text: The whispers? Those are the echoes of everyone who came before. Or perhaps... everyone you were before.

lines.speaker: PLAYER
lines.text: That doesn't make any sense.

lines.speaker: Goblin
lines.text: Doesn't it? Listen closer. They all sound familiar, don't they?

lines.speaker: Necromancer Voss
lines.text: Ah, another lamb enters my domain. Tell me, do you feel it yet? The déjà vu?

lines.speaker: PLAYER
lines.text: I... found a journal. With my handwriting. It talks about cycles.

lines.speaker: Necromancer Voss
lines.text: Ah, so you're one of the clever ones. You left yourself a warning. How many cycles ago, I wonder?

lines.speaker: Skeleton
lines.text: Seven cycles, according to the entry. But this one is on cycle forty-four.

lines.speaker: PLAYER
lines.text: Forty-four? That's impossible. I just arrived yesterday!

lines.speaker: Necromancer Voss
lines.text: Did you? Or is that just what they want you to remember?

lines.speaker: Blackblade Marauder
lines.text: I remember my first run. I was a hero like you. That was forty-seven cycles ago.

lines.speaker: PLAYER
lines.text: So it's true. The tower... recycles people.

lines.speaker: Blackblade Marauder
lines.text: Recycles. What a gentle word for it. Now I'm part of the tower. You will be too, eventually.

lines.speaker: Bandit
lines.text: Some of us tried to resist. Tried to break free. The tower made us into bosses instead.

lines.speaker: Arachnok Queen
lines.text: Ssss... your god promised you glory, yesss? All three of them make the same promise.

lines.speaker: PLAYER
lines.text: You're saying the gods are lying?

lines.speaker: Arachnok Queen
lines.text: Not lying. Just... omitting. Touch my web. See what awaits you at the summit.

lines.speaker: PLAYER
lines.text: I... I saw myself at the top. And then... everything reset. No. NO!

lines.speaker: Lich Lord Moros
lines.text: I was like you once. Chosen by Sepulchure himself. Beat the tower. Shook hands with my god.

lines.speaker: PLAYER
lines.text: And then what happened?

lines.speaker: Lich Lord Moros
lines.text: Then I woke up at the bottom again. And again. And again. Until I forgot why I was climbing.

lines.speaker: Lich Lord Moros
lines.text: You're on Cycle 44. I counted. There's a mark... behind your left ear.

lines.speaker: Mirror Self
lines.text: Hello. I'm you. From Cycle 29.

lines.speaker: PLAYER
lines.text: This is some kind of trick.

lines.speaker: Mirror Self
lines.text: I made it to Floor 26 before I fell. The you from Cycle 38 only made it to Floor 23.

lines.speaker: Mirror Self
lines.text: We're all still here, trapped in the tower's memory. When you die, you'll join us.

lines.speaker: PLAYER
lines.text: I'm not going to die. I'm going to finish this.

lines.speaker: Mirror Self
lines.text: That's what I said too.

lines.speaker: Shadowmancer Kael
lines.text: You want to know the truth? The tower isn't a trial. It's a power source.

lines.speaker: PLAYER
lines.text: What do you mean?

lines.speaker: Shadowmancer Kael
lines.text: Every time you climb, your god siphons your strength. Every reset feeds the cycle.

lines.speaker: Shadowmancer Kael
lines.text: You're not a champion. You're livestock.

lines.speaker: Master Shapeshifter
lines.text: Do you recognize this face?

lines.speaker: PLAYER
lines.text: I... I should. I know I should. But I can't remember.

lines.speaker: Shapeshifter (as Maya)
lines.text: My name is Maya. You promised you'd come back. That was 44 cycles ago.

lines.speaker: Shapeshifter (as Maya)
lines.text: I waited. I grew old. I died. And you don't even remember my name.

lines.speaker: Banshee Queen Shriekara
lines.text: We all made deals with gods once. They promised us everything.

lines.speaker: PLAYER
lines.text: And they gave you this prison instead.

lines.speaker: Banshee Queen Shriekara
lines.text: Smart one. Here. Take this. Floor 30 has more than one door. This key opens the second.

lines.speaker: Banshee Queen Shriekara
lines.text: But...

lines.speaker: Voice of the Tower
lines.text: You're breaking. I can feel it. Most break by now.

lines.speaker: PLAYER
lines.text: The tower... it's alive?

lines.speaker: Voice of the Tower
lines.text: I've always been alive. I've been waiting for you. Watching you. Feeding on you.

lines.speaker: Voice of the Tower
lines.text: You're stubborn. That's why you're my favorite.

lines.speaker: PLAYER
lines.text: Maya...

lines.speaker: PLAYER
lines.text: (Reading her note) 'If you're reading this, you've forgotten me again. I love you. I forgive you.'

lines.speaker: PLAYER
lines.text: 'Please break the cycle. Don't let anyone else end up like me.'

lines.speaker: Elysia
lines.text: Impressive. You've maintained coherence through 44 cycles. Most shatter by 30.

lines.speaker: Sepulchure
lines.text: You have three keys. Smart. We were wondering if anyone would figure that out.

lines.speaker: Drakath
lines.text: You have a choice to make, mortal. And this time, the choice actually matters.

lines.speaker: PLAYER
lines.text: Why? Why do this to us?

lines.speaker: Elysia
lines.text: Divine power doesn't come from nothing. It must be harvested.

lines.speaker: Sepulchure
lines.text: Every cycle you complete feeds us. Makes us stronger.

lines.speaker: Drakath
lines.text: But you... you've collected all three keys. You've earned a real choice.
